Award.AwardTitle: Conference: Harmonic Analysis, Complex Analysis, Spectral Theory and All That
Award.AbstractNarration:
The conference "Harmonic Analysis, Complex Analysis, Spectral Theory and All That" will be held at The Mathematical Research and Conference Center (MRCC) in Bedlewo, Poland, July 31-August 6, 2016. The conference enter belongs to the Institute of Mathematics of Polish Academy of Sciences - International Banach Center. It is expected that about 100 participants will come from Canada, Finland, France, Germany, Israel, Norway, Poland, Spain, Russia, Sweden, USA and other countries. A significant number, about 30, of the participants will be PhD students and postdoctoral fellows. One of the aims of the conference is to bring graduate students to geometric harmonic analysis where there are a wide range of applications. The conference organizers aim to reach the critical mass of young scholars, women and men, that will intensify interdisciplinary interaction already in their post-doc phase with senior researchers.

This conference, in major part, focusses on recent advances in harmonic and complex analysis with numerous connections and important applications in mind. The aim is to strongly promote linkages between the modern theory of 2D-geometric analysis (in its various manifestations, including holomorphic dynamics, inverse conductivity problems, partial differential equations, geometric measure theory calculus of variations, fractal geometry) with other possible developments, thereby bringing new ideas and results to each field. The organizing committee's background and experience affirm those goals.

More information can be found on the conference website: http://bcc.impan.pl/16Harmonic/

POR.DRECONTENT:
The conference “Harmonic Analysis, Complex Analysis, Spectral Theory and All That” was held at The Mathematical Research and Conference Center (MRCC) in Bedlewo, Poland, August 1 - August 5, 2016. The URL address: \;http://bcc.impan.pl/16Harmonic/. The aim was to encourage the dissemination of new methods in one-dimensional complex analysis and to enhance the understanding of the pervasive nature of the area in various connections with other fields of contemporary mathematics. About 100 participants came from Canada, Finland, France, Germany, Israel, Norway, Poland, Spain, Russia, Sweden, USA and other countries.

The proposal requested funding to support travel expenses of US participants (graduate students, postdoctoral scholars and some faculty); mainly to cover flights from the USA to Poland. Ten participants have been funded. Of them, 9 were graduate students or postdoctoral scholars and 1 was a senior scholar.

Motivation and outcome. In spite of tremendous impact of the electronic media on mathematical research nowadays, it will never supersede personal contacts among scientists. Especially, participation of promising young mathematicians in the international conferences plays an important role in future developments. A long term program of the PI is to bring graduate students to harmonic and geometric analysis. It aims to reach the critical mass of young scholars, women and men, to intensify interdisciplinary interaction already in their post-doc phase with leading researchers. The young participants of this meeting have learnt new directions and initiatives. The conference in Bedlewo provided such an environment. Its special location attracts many talented scholars from Central and Easter Europe who do not have the means to visit the USA. It is a quiet, spacious and relaxing place for research and study. MRCC provided substantial organizational and financial assistance with local expenses. Having full board and lodging provided, the participants engrossed themselves in mathematics. The presence of the world class mathematicians certainly improved the international recognition of the novice US fellows.
